comments:
Error when doing Refactoring > Change method signature on Eclipse 3 M4
I was adding a new parameter to a constructor. This bug only happened after
doing several refactorings on the base class and its subclasses.

Claude, do you have a reproducible test case?
Or more information about the constructor to which you added a parameter:
- compile errors in the original source?
- constructor arguments before/after refactoring?
- superconstructors existing || default (implicit) constructor definition?
- calls to super(...)?
- anonymous classes involved?

Thanks for your test case. However, I still can't reproduce the bug (neither in
M5 nor in M4). I tried it with and without an implementation for ModelException
as well as with clients calling the constructors.

Could you please give me a step-by-step description of your setup?
(e.g.
- create a project 'ScopeMVC'
- create a package 'org.scopemvc.impl.model.convert'
- put the class ConvertException.java into that package
- select 'ConvertException(Object source, String msgCode, Throwable cause)' in
the outline and choose Refactoring > Change Method Signature
- click 'Remove' button, click 'OK',
- on the problem page, click 'continue'
- ...
- -> exception in the log
)

That would be very helpful, since I don't like adding protection code for an NPE
I don't understand.

Markus,

You can try download the full project, it's available from cvs HEAD:
cvs -z3 -d:pserver:anonymous@cvs.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/scope co scopemvc2

The problem may be more complex, with refactored code involved somewhere. 

And i'm able to reproduce this bug on M5.

I downloaded the project but couldn't reproduce the exception,
neither in M4 nor in M6. I tried various changes in the method
signatures, including removing the "Object source" parameter from
each of them. (Ludovic -- first you write that refactoring works
well on the first two constructors, but then you say "Refactoring on
ConvertException(Object source, String msgCode, Throwable cause) fails." --
but this is the second constructor.)

Closing for now, since the problem could not be reproduced (Felix: thanks for
trying it!).
Please reopen if there's more information or it happens again.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 74035 ***
